author: LqkUWp
body:
<!--


This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## For w32time, Winmgmt, wbengine, or WinRM service, there is an error. 

### Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Get-Service w32time | Select-Object *
```

### Expected behavior

```none
print all properties of w32time service object
```

### Actual behavior

```none
UserName            : NT AUTHORITY\LocalService
out-lineoutput: startIndex cannot be larger than length of string. (Parameter 'startIndex')
```

## But for shpamsvc or TroubleshootingSvc service, the command works fine. 

### Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Get-Service shpamsvc | Select-Object *
```

### Expected behavior

```none
print all properties of shpamsvc service object
```

### Actual behavior

```none
UserName            : LocalSystem
Description         : Manages profiles and accounts on a SharedPC configured device
DelayedAutoStart    : False
BinaryPathName      : C:\WINDOWS\System32\svchost.exe -k netsvcs -p
StartupType         : Disabled
Name                : shpamsvc
RequiredServices    : {RpcSs, ProfSvc}
CanPauseAndContinue : False
CanShutdown         : False
CanStop             : False
DisplayName         : Shared PC Account Manager
DependentServices   : {}
MachineName         : .
ServiceName         : shpamsvc
ServicesDependedOn  : {RpcSs, ProfSvc}
StartType           : Disabled
ServiceHandle       :
Status              : Stopped
ServiceType         : Win32ShareProcess
Site                :
Container           :
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0-preview.5
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0-preview.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Just as a data point: on my Windows 10.0.18363 with `en-US` as the current culture, I don't see the problem.
What is your current culture (`$PSCulture`)?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> out-lineoutput: startIndex cannot be larger than length of string. (Parameter 'startIndex')

Something was wrong when printing the properties of the `w32time` service object. Can you run `Get-Service w32time | Select-Object *` again, then run `Get-Error` and paster the output here?

comments.author: LqkUWp

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@LqkUWp Thanks for sharing the error! Can you please also run the following and share the results?
```
## this may result in the same failure
Get-Service w32time | Format-List *
```
and
```
Get-Service w32time | % Description
```
Also, the windows size and buffer size when you run into this exception:
```
"Window width: $([System.Console]::WindowWidth)"
"Window height: $([System.Console]::WindowWidth)"
"Buffer width: $([System.Console]::BufferWidth)"
"Buffer width: $([System.Console]::BufferHeight)"
```

comments.author: LqkUWp
comments.body:
@daxian-dbw 

* `Get-Service w32time | Format-List *`

  the result is 

  ```
  UserName            : NT AUTHORITY\LocalService
  out-lineoutput: startIndex cannot be larger than length of string. (Parameter 'startIndex')
  ```

* `Get-Service w32time | % Description`

  the result is 

  ```
  维护在网络上的所有客户端和服务器的时间和日期同步。如果此服务被停止，时间和日期的同步将不可用。如果此服务被禁用，任何明确依赖它的服务都将不能启动。
  ```

* windows size and buffer size

  ```
  PS> "Window width: $([System.Console]::WindowWidth)"
  Window width: 90
  PS> "Window height: $([System.Console]::WindowHeight)"
  Window height: 27
  PS> "Buffer width: $([System.Console]::BufferWidth)"
  Buffer width: 90
  PS> "Buffer height: $([System.Console]::BufferHeight)"
  Buffer height: 27
  ```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Thanks @LqkUWp, we should be able to repro the issue with the provided information.

title: "get-service myservice | select-object *" works differently for different "myservice"
